thread.title: Copper Dips Below $5,000 a Ton Amid China Concerns
thread.title_full: Copper Dips Below $5,000 a Ton Amid China Concerns - WSJ

author: Ese Erheriene
title: Copper Dips Below $5,000 a Ton Amid China Concerns
text:
LONDON—Copper futures dipped below $5,000 on Tuesday in London, for the first time since the financial crisis, dropping below a key level in a market that has been hit hard by mounting concerns over the health of China’s economy.
The red metal is under renewed pressure as speculative investors around the world take advantage of the summer trading lull to take short positions on some commodities. This comes amid a selloff on the...
